item.title: 2023年05月24日 (水)
item.dc:creator: Ahiさん
item.description: A viewer asked to see my furigana. I’m a clown who didn’t ever finish properly furigana’ing a Chapter of 花物語 Hanamonogatari. So I’m gonna do as much as I can today! Duolingo
item.content:encoded:
A viewer asked to see my furigana. I’m a clown who didn’t ever finish properly furigana’ing a Chapter of 花物語 Hanamonogatari. So I’m gonna do as much as I can today!

Duolingo

忘れた

独身 – どくしん

独

  1. Radical (犭)
  2. Inu
  1. Radical (身)
  2. body

別れる – わかれます

to part

  1. Radical (刀)
  2. knife

撮りません – とりません

to take a photo

  1. Radical (扌)
  2. hand

彼氏 – かれし

boyfriend!

  1. Radical (氏) うじ
  2. Clan

去年 – きょねん

last year

  1. Radical (厶) む
  2. Part (土)

item.title: 2023年05月23日 (火)
item.dc:creator: Ahiさん
item.description: A day of listening immersion. Ran the Whisper script to create a transcript for〜アスティカシア〜ラジオ 第32回. And completed the v1 of said transcript. No kanji checks yet、 that’ll be for another day. Duolingo Unit 32 – Express days and times
item.content:encoded:
A day of listening immersion. Ran the Whisper script to create a transcript for〜アスティカシア〜ラジオ 第32回. And completed the v1 of said transcript. No kanji checks yet、 that’ll be for another day.

Duolingo

Unit 32 – Express days and times

新しい語句

死にました – しにました

  1. Not the “I died” politely
  2. Radical (歹) がつぶしゅ
忘れた

先月 – しにました

  1. Don’t @ me. I’m fake. I forget.
  2. Radical for 先 (儿) legs
  3. Meaning: Before, Last

離婚 – しにました

  1. D i v o r c e
  2. Radicals (亠) (隹)

item.title: 2023年05月21日 (日)
item.dc:creator: Ahiさん
item.description: Its a new month, you know what that means. A monthly game of … how do I say this month in Japanese. This time, I figured since April was “#”-gatsu, May too would be 05-gatsu. I’m curious, why are all the Japanese months denoted as Number-Gatsu versus latin/english where the months (not including the -embers) […]
item.content:encoded:
Its a new month, you know what that means. A monthly game of … how do I say this month in Japanese. This time, I figured since April was “#”-gatsu, May too would be 05-gatsu. I’m curious, why are all the Japanese months denoted as Number-Gatsu versus latin/english where the months (not including the -embers) are named after the Roman gods?

旧暦 きゅうれき

The きゅうれき was used between 1868-1912. It’s denoted as a ‘lunar’ calendar.

睦月 – むつき

睦 intimate, friendly, harmonious

如月 – きさらぎ

弥生

卯月

皐月

水無月

文月

葉月

長月

神無月

霜月

師走

Sources

Jisho. 旧暦. Web.

Ikki Sake. Japanese Calendar Year Mutsuki Kisaragi Yayoi. Web.

How do I say May

ごがつ May

Duolingo

Unit 32 – Express days and times

新しい語句

Atarashi Gakkou? No, Atarashi Goku

多分 – たぶん

Probably

多 many

Radical – 夕 – ゆうべ – evening

分 part

Radical – 刀 – かたな – blade

引っ越す – ひっこします

To move houses

item.title: 16 April 2023
item.dc:creator: Ahiさん
item.description: Holy shit how do I say April in Japanese. Did Duolingo fail me. Or did I fail myself. Kanji Learned Today
item.content:encoded:
Holy shit how do I say April in Japanese. Did Duolingo fail me. Or did I fail myself.

Research + Answer

４月

しがつ

I should’ve known … 四月は君の嘘 ENG speakers look that up for a pleasant surprise. CW: early 2010s middle school trauma.

しがつ

April is the start month for schools. There’s also a terminology ４月病, which is the euphoria experienced by college students or workplace recruits at the beginning of school or work. (Jisho 2023) Is this like the ENG terminology for “Senioritis” or statement “New [School] Year, New Me”

Kanji Learned Today
